casebody.data:
Louis A. BRESLERMAN, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. AMERICAN LIBERTY INSURANCE COMPANY, Commercial Union Fire Insurance Company of New York and Monarch Insurance Company of Ohio, Defendants-Appellees. No. 274, Docket 28474. United States Court of Appeals Second Circuit. Argued Jan. 24, 1964. Decided Jan. 24, 1964.

Before FRIENDLY and HAYS, Circuit Judges, and ANDERSON, District Judge.*

Harry H. Goebel, New York City, for appellant. Ernest E. Rosenberg, New York City (Rein, Mound & Cotton, New York City), for defendants-appellees.

Sitting by designation.

 PER CURIAM.

We affirm in open court upon the well-reasoned opinion of Judge Wyatt. D.C., 218 F.Supp. 345.
